channel.title: Death by Monster Truck
channel.description:
MADISON, Wis. — A federal safety official says a preliminary investigation suggests the death of a Monster Truck show promoter from Ohio was an accident. Kim Stille, director of the Occupational Safety & Health Administration's office in Madison, Wis., says her agency's investigation has not turned up any obvious safety issues. She says the investigation continues but "it does appear to be a tragic accident." Authorities say 41-year-old George Eisenhart Jr. of Chardon, Ohio, died on Saturday night when he stepped into the path of one of the huge trucks during the Motor Sports Monster Truck & Thrill Show. Coroner John Stanley says preliminary investigation shows neither the victim nor the driver saw each other before the collision.
Source: http://www.daytondailynews.com/n/content/gen/ap/WI_Monster_Truck_Death.html

item.title: Death by Monster Truck
item.dc:creator: @Not_X_A_Alex Not X A Alex
item.description:
@Not_X_A_Alex wrote:

I saw this on the news. That would really suck for the family.

Read full topic

item.title: Death by Monster Truck
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

[quote=“Uriko, post:4, topic:258669”][quote author=jme link=topic=341563.msg2642911#msg2642911 date=1233010452]

Yeah, it was such an ironic story too. My sister saw that…she was in Madison watching that show at the time. (I’m about 2 hours from Madison)

Yes, he said he felt good about his company and that his company ran different and was safer.

I don’t really see how it’s ironic to die from entering a monster truck arena during the middle of a show…
[/quote]It doesn’t say in that crappy news article, but in another one the it said the guy was proclaiming how safe everything was etc., I think.[/quote]

Read full topic
